 45namespace impl

 47
 48/// Compute next power of 2 after len.
 49
 50inline length_type
 51next_power_of_2(length_type len)
 52{
 53  length_type pow2 = 1;
 54  while (pow2 < len)
 55    pow2 *= 2;
 56  return pow2;
 57}
 58
 59
 60
 61// Choose FFT size for overlap and add.
 62
 63inline length_type
 64choose_fft_size(length_type M, length_type N)
 65{
 66  if (M+N < 1024)
 67    return next_power_of_2(M+N);
 68  if (4*next_power_of_2(M) > 1024)
 69    return 4*next_power_of_2(M);
 70  return 1024;
 71}
 72
 73template <dimension_type      D,
 74	  support_region_type Supp,
 75	  typename            T,
 76	  unsigned            n_times,
 77          alg_hint_type       a_hint>
 78class Correlation_fft
 79{
 80  typedef typename Complex_of<T>::type complex_type;
 81
 82  static dimension_type const dim = D;
 83
 84  // Compile-time constants.
 85public:
 86  static support_region_type const supprt  = Supp;
 87
 88  // Constructors, copies, assignments, and destructors.
 89public:
 90  Correlation_fft(
 91    Domain<dim> const&   ref_size,
 92    Domain<dim> const&   input_size)
 93    VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc));
 94
 95  Correlation_fft(Correlation_fft const&) VSIP_NOTHROW;
 96  Correlation_fft& operator=(Correlation_fft const&) VSIP_NOTHROW;
 97  ~Correlation_fft() VSIP_NOTHROW {}
 98
 99  // Accessors.
100public:
101  Domain<dim> const& reference_size() const VSIP_NOTHROW  { return ref_size_; }
102  Domain<dim> const& input_size() const VSIP_NOTHROW   { return input_size_; }
103  Domain<dim> const& output_size() const VSIP_NOTHROW  { return output_size_; }
104
105  float impl_performance(char* what) const
106  {
107    if (!strcmp(what, "in_ext_cost")) return pm_in_ext_cost_;
108    else if (!strcmp(what, "out_ext_cost")) return pm_out_ext_cost_;
109    else if (!strcmp(what, "non-opt-calls")) return pm_non_opt_calls_;
110    else return 0.f;
111  }
112
113  // Implementation functions.
114public:
115  template <typename Block0,
116	    typename Block1,
117	    typename Block2>
118  void
119  impl_correlate(bias_type               bias,
120	    const_Vector<T, Block0> ref,
121	    const_Vector<T, Block1> in,
122	    Vector<T, Block2>       out)
123    VSIP_NOTHROW;
124
125  template <typename Block0,
126	    typename Block1,
127	    typename Block2>
128  void
129  impl_correlate(bias_type               bias,
130	    const_Matrix<T, Block0> ref,
131	    const_Matrix<T, Block1> in,
132	    Matrix<T, Block2>       out)
133    VSIP_NOTHROW;
134
135  typedef Layout<1, row1_type, Stride_unit, Cmplx_inter_fmt> layout_type;
136  typedef Vector<T> coeff_view_type;
137  typedef impl::Ext_data<typename coeff_view_type::block_type, layout_type> c_ext_type;
138
139  // Member data.
140private:
141  Domain<dim>     ref_size_;
142  Domain<dim>     input_size_;
143  Domain<dim>     output_size_;
144
145  length_type	  n_fft_;	// length of fft to overlap
146  length_type	  N2_;		// legnth of zero-pad in overlap
147  length_type	  N1_;		// length of real-data in overlap
148
149  Fft<const_Vector, T, complex_type,
150      Type_equal<T, complex_type>::value ? fft_fwd : 0, by_reference>
151		f_fft_;
152
153  Fft<const_Vector, complex_type, T,
154      Type_equal<T, complex_type>::value ? fft_inv : 0, by_reference>
155		i_fft_;
156
157  length_type	  fft_fd_size_;
158
159  Vector<T>            t_in_;	// temporary input - time domain
160  Vector<T>            t_ref_;	// temporary ref   - time domain
161  Vector<complex_type> f_in_;	// temporary input - freq domain
162  Vector<complex_type> f_ref_;	// temporary ref   - freq domain
163
164  int             pm_non_opt_calls_;
165  size_t          pm_ref_ext_cost_;
166  size_t          pm_in_ext_cost_;
167  size_t          pm_out_ext_cost_;
168};
169
170
171
172/***********************************************************************
173  Definitions
174***********************************************************************/
175
176/// Construct a correlation object.
177
178template <dimension_type      D,
179	  support_region_type Supp,
180	  typename            T,
181	  unsigned            n_times,
182          alg_hint_type       a_hint>
183Correlation_fft<D, Supp, T, n_times, a_hint>::Correlation_fft(
184  Domain<dim> const&   ref_size,
185  Domain<dim> const&   input_size)
186VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc))
187  : ref_size_   (normalize(ref_size)),
188    input_size_ (normalize(input_size)),
189    output_size_(conv_output_size(Supp, ref_size_, input_size_, 1)),
190
191    n_fft_      (choose_fft_size(ref_size_.size(), input_size_.size())),
192    N2_         (ref_size_.size()),
193    N1_	        (n_fft_-N2_),
194
195    f_fft_      (n_fft_, 1.0),
196    i_fft_      (n_fft_, 1.0/n_fft_),
197    fft_fd_size_(f_fft_.output_size().size()),
198    t_in_       (n_fft_),
199    t_ref_      (n_fft_),
200    f_in_       (fft_fd_size_),
201    f_ref_      (fft_fd_size_),
202
203    pm_non_opt_calls_ (0)
204{
205}
206
207// Perform 1-D correlation.
208
209template <dimension_type      D,
210	  support_region_type Supp,
211	  typename            T,
212	  unsigned            n_times,
213          alg_hint_type       a_hint>
214template <typename Block0,
215	  typename Block1,
216	  typename Block2>
217void
218Correlation_fft<D, Supp, T, n_times, a_hint>::impl_correlate(
219  bias_type               bias,
220  const_Vector<T, Block0> ref,
221  const_Vector<T, Block1> in,
222  Vector<T, Block2>       out)
223VSIP_NOTHROW
224{
225  length_type const M = this->ref_size_[0].size();
226  length_type const N = this->input_size_[0].size();
227  length_type const P = this->output_size_[0].size();
228
229  assert(M == ref.size());
230  assert(N == in.size());
231  assert(P == out.size());
232
233
234  // Transform the reference
235  t_ref_(Domain<1>(0, 1, M))      = ref;
236  t_ref_(Domain<1>(M, 1, n_fft_-M)) = T();
237  f_fft_(t_ref_, f_ref_);
238
239
240  // Determine how much to "shift" the output vector.
241  length_type shift;
242
243  if (Supp == support_full)
244    shift = N2_-(M-1);
245  else if (Supp == support_same)
246    shift = N2_-(M/2);
247  else
248    shift = N2_-0;
249
250  
251  // Perform correlation using overlap and add
252
253  for (index_type i=0; i*N1_ < N; ++i)
254  {
255    // Copy input
256    if (N1_ > N - i*N1_)
257    {
258      length_type n_copy = N - i*N1_;
259      t_in_(Domain<1>(0,  1, N2_))     = T();
260      t_in_(Domain<1>(N2_, 1, n_copy)) = in(Domain<1>(i*N1_, 1, n_copy));
261      t_in_(Domain<1>(N2_+n_copy, 1, N1_-n_copy)) = T();
262    }
263    else
264    {
265      t_in_(Domain<1>(0,  1, N2_))  = T();
266      t_in_(Domain<1>(N2_, 1, N1_)) = in(Domain<1>(i*N1_, 1, N1_));
267    }
268
269    // Perform correlation
270    f_fft_(t_in_,  f_in_);
271
272    f_in_ = f_in_ * impl_conj(f_ref_);
273    i_fft_(f_in_, t_in_);
274    t_in_ = impl_conj(t_in_);
275
276    // Copy output (with overlap-add)
277    if (i == 0)
278    {
279      length_type len = std::min(N1_+N2_-shift, P);
280      out(Domain<1>(0, 1, len)) = t_in_(Domain<1>(shift, 1, len));
281    }
282    else if (i*N1_+N1_+N2_-shift < P)
283    {
284      out(Domain<1>(i*N1_-shift,     1, N2_)) += t_in_(Domain<1>(0,   1, N2_));
285      out(Domain<1>(i*N1_+N2_-shift, 1, N1_))  = t_in_(Domain<1>(N2_, 1, N1_));
286    }
287    else
288    {
289      length_type len1 = std::min(P - (i*N1_-shift), N2_);
290      if (len1 > 0)
291	out(Domain<1>(i*N1_-shift, 1, len1)) += t_in_(Domain<1>(0, 1, len1));
292
293      length_type len2 = std::min(P - (i*N1_+N2_-shift), N1_);
294      if (len2 > 0)
295	out(Domain<1>(i*N1_+N2_-shift, 1, len2)) =
296	  t_in_(Domain<1>(N2_, 1, len2));
297    }
298  }
299
300
301  // Unbias the result (if requested).
302
303  if (bias == unbiased)
304  {
305    if (Supp == support_full)
306    {
307      if (M > 1)
308      {
309	out(Domain<1>(0, 1, M-1))     /= ramp(T(1), T(1), M-1);
310	out(Domain<1>(P-M+1, 1, M-1)) /= ramp(T(M-1), T(-1), M-1);
311      }
312      if (P+2 > 2*M)
313	out(Domain<1>(M-1, 1, P-2*M+2)) /= T(M);
314    }
315    else if (Supp == support_same)
316    {
317      length_type edge  = M - (M/2);
318
319      if (edge > 0)
320      {
321	out(Domain<1>(0, 1, edge))      /= ramp(T(M/2 + (M%2)), T(1), edge);
322#if VSIP_IMPL_CORR_CORRECT_SAME_SUPPORT_SCALING
323	out(Domain<1>(P-edge, 1, edge)) /= ramp(T(M), T(-1), edge);
324#else
325	out(Domain<1>(P-edge, 1, edge)) /= ramp(T(M-(1-M%2)), T(-1), edge);
326#endif
327      }
328      if (P > 2*edge)
329	out(Domain<1>(edge, 1, P - 2*edge)) /= T(M);
330    }
331    else // (Supp == support_min)
332    {
333      out /= T(M);
334    }
335  }
336}
337
338
339
340// Perform 2-D correlation.
341
342template <dimension_type      D,
343	  support_region_type Supp,
344	  typename            T,
345	  unsigned            n_times,
346          alg_hint_type       a_hint>
347template <typename Block0,
348	  typename Block1,
349	  typename Block2>
350void
351Correlation_fft<D, Supp, T, n_times, a_hint>::impl_correlate(
352  bias_type               bias,
353  const_Matrix<T, Block0> ref,
354  const_Matrix<T, Block1> in,
355  Matrix<T, Block2>       out)
356VSIP_NOTHROW
357{
358  VSIP_IMPL_THROW(vsip::impl::unimplemented(
359    "Correlation_fft: 2D correlation not implemented."));
360}

365namespace vsip_csl
366{
367namespace dispatcher
368{
369template <support_region_type R,
370          typename            T,
371	  unsigned            N,
372          alg_hint_type       H>
373struct Evaluator<op::corr<1, R, T, N, H>, be::opt>
374{
375  static bool const ct_valid = true;
376  typedef vsip::impl::Correlation_fft<1, R, T, N, H> backend_type;
377};
378} // namespace vsip_csl::dispatcher
